titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Anthony R. Soto Papers, 1950-1993
titlepage.publisher:
Department of Special Collections and University Archives
Stanford University Libraries
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 2002 The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: The collection includes manuscripts, subject files, and newsclippings, primarily relating to Soto's research and teaching on Hispanics in the Catholic Church and migrant workers in California.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Anthony R. Soto Papers. M0763. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Professor at the School of Social Work, San Jose State University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Manuscripts, subject files, and newsclippings, primarily relating to Soto's research and teaching on Hispanics in the Catholic Church and migrant workers in California.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Mexican Americans.
Migrant labor.

did.unittitle: Series 1. History of California Farmworkers in Newspaper clippings
Spiralbound copies of transcribed interview of Antonio Soto by Josie Negrete, UC Santa Cruz (first date given 7/2/93)
Essay, "Dimensions of Religiosity in the Mexican American Community of the New Almaden Quicksilver Mines, 1848-1908." By AS

scopecontent.p: Includes attached letter to and comments from Dr. Matt Meier, History, Santa Clara Univ.

did.unittitle: Transcribed interview of AS by Gloria Cuadraz, (Ph.D., UC Berkeley, 1993).

scopecontent.p: Attached letter from Dr. Cuadraz.

did.unittitle: "History of Our Lady of Guadalupe parish" by AS

Essay, "Chicano Workers in the New Almaden Quicksilver Minse of Northern California, 1848-1908. By AS in Chicano Social & Political History in the 19th Century, ed. Griswold del Castillo & Hidalgo (Floricanto Press, 1994) (3 copies)
Notes on "Life history method" by John Clausen
Assorted course papers/family histories from AS' students in Mexican American Graduate Studies 125, SJSU
"Agricultural Continuum: A Descriptive Study of the Farmworker Population and the Settling-Out Process" By Dept. Health, Education & Welfare.
"The Church in California and the Chicano: A Sociological Analysis," / Anthony Soto. -- In Grito Del Sol 4:1 (1979).
Selections from Virgilio Elizondo's Christianity & Culture (p. 174-194).
"The Church" from Meier & Rivera's Dictionary of Mex Am History (entry written by AS).

scopecontent.p: Also typescript copy.

scopecontent.p: Also one complete issue.

"Catholicism in China Today: Accomodation or Anachronism?" (sic) / by Anthony Soto(7/20/84)

did.unittitle: PADRES (Padres Asociados para Derechos Religiosos Educativos y Sociales

scopecontent.p: [Chicano priests org.] -- Misc. newsletters, docs, 1974-75 -- Correspondence

Copy of article on formation of BCSS (Monitor, 2/10/77) -- Copy of "Official US Census Bureau Preliminary Spanish Language Population Stats," 1/24/72 -- Letter from Paul Sedillo (Div. for Spanish-Speaking) to Reynaldo (presumably Reynaldo Flores), 11/24/71. Documents priests' resistance to offices for Spanish-speaking -- Newsletter from PADRES documenting convention issues and 'walkout,' by Reynaldo Flores, 2/10/70. -- Dissertation notes -- Copy news article on Guadalupe Church, 9/23/73 -- Regeneracion, 1:8 (1970)

Memo to Charles O'Brien, Asst Attny Gen from Harry Cooper, Special Agent, docs on working conditions, 12/29/59 -- Newsletter of Imperial Valley Farmers Assn. -- Statement by AFL-CIO Executive Council on Migratory Agricultural Labor -- "Statement of Importation of Japanese Farmworkers," Cal State Federation of Labor, 4/23/57
Docs on lettuce boycott, Proposition 22, 1972

Flyer for Colegio Jacinto Trevino -- list of lectures by AS, 1973-74 -- Barrio youth conference flyers -- "Making it Happen: About the Community Organization Steps" training pamphlet -- Newsletter, Division for Spanish-Speaking

scopecontent.p: Also includes: National Catholic Reporter, Opinion magazine 2/14/75 -- Selections from World and Peoples' World

El Tecolote 2:4 (10/27/71) -- Sedition 1:5 (1/10/72) -- La Voz del Pueblo 2:9 (Nov 71) -- La Voz de la Raza 1:8 (6/1/70) -- Chicanismo 3:1A (Nov 71) -- Nuestra Tierra 2:1 (5/4/79) by MEChA at SJSU -- Salt of the Earth 1:10 (Dec 71)

Series 2. Papers for Stanford Chicano Library Archives

scopecontent.p: Letter, Francis Guest, O.F.M. to AS, 3/15/91 -- B & W photo, Anthony Soto & George Mroczkowski, 1958. -- Letter, Huntington Library to AS, 1991. -- Pamphlet: "Indian Life at Mission San Luis Rey" -- Pamphlet: "San Luis Rey Mission Fiesta" 1959 w/pic of AS & G. Mroczkowski. -- Copy, "Mission San Luis Rey, California--Excavations in the Sunken Gardens" by AS, KIVA: Journal of Arizona Archaeological and Historical Society 26:4 (1961). -- Article: "Uncovering the Past at Mission San Luis Rey," featuring AS, written by Frank Graham, Westways (May 1958). -- Misc. news articles on San Luis Rey

did.unittitle: Booklet: "Cultural Historic Landscape Preservation Proposal," Mission San Luis Rey, 10/25/90.

scopecontent.p: President's Report, CRU 3/19/72 -- CRU Constitution, 3/16/72 -- Letters, Jack Ybarra, CRU President to Father AS at Guadalupe Church, 1971-2. -- Press release on Fiesta de las Rosas boycott, 5/16/69 -- Misc. meeting minutes, 1969-70s -- List of CRU affiliates

did.unittitle: Book/let: "The Chicano and the Church: Study of a Minority Within a Religious Institution," Marfel Associates, March 1975.

scopecontent.p: "The Structure of Society According to Duns Scotus," by AS, Franciscan Studies 12:1 (March 1952). -- "Los Chicanos y las Iglesias," estudios ecumenicos, 11/71. -- "Painful Migration: The Life History of a Mexican Immigrant," June 1973. -- "Bracero Mission," Apostolic Perspectives 3:2 (Summer 1958). -- "Sociology of the Migrant Family," Franciscan Educational Conference Proceedings, vol. 41 (Aug 1960). -- "Una Platica: Mexican American Approaches to Death and Dying," by AS and Jose Villa. -- "Practical Aspects of Caring for the Dying in a Mexican American Culture," panel presentation at Stanford University, "Dilemmas in the Care of the Dying," October 1983. -- "The Spirit of the Cursillo" in Ultreya 4:6 (June 1962). -- "Early Beginnings of the Cursillo Movement in the Bay Area, California" mss. -- "The Cursillo Movement" mss. -- Catholic Rural Life, complete copies of June 1960 and July 1960, featuring articles by AS ("Human Misery for Sale" parts 1 and 2). -- Pamphlet: "Migrants in Your Parish" -- Homiletic & Pastoral Review, 6/61, 9/61, 3/69 featuring -- "Migrants in Your Parish," 6/61 -- Letters to editor about "Migrants" article, 9/61 -- "Getting Through to Our Spanish Speaking," 3/69 -- "The Cursillo Movement," in The Inner Crusade, by Tom Hennessey (Loyola U Press, 1965) -- "The Bracero Story," Commonweal 71:9 (11/27/59)
"Migration Life Histories of Chicanos--as told by themselves" July 1985 -- Various drafts of life histories, 3 color slides, one color photo of Sara Segovia

Galleys of AS' article on Quicksilver Mines for Floricanot Press -- Corr: Stanford Libraries to AS -- AS to Floricanto Press (multiple) -- AS to Griswold del Castillo.(multiple) -- b & w photos, apparently from Stanford archives
Misc. news clippings on mines, mine area, local folks -- Misc. notes, documents, interview notes

Leo Maher, 12/22/71 (ongoing dispute over numbers of Mexican-American Catholics) -- Lecture notes, Bishop Roger Mahony, "The Role of the Church, Faith, and Collegial Relationships."
